function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Articles focused on covid-19, spanish influenza, h1n1, and generic \n’influenza’ or ’pandemic influenza’ increase the risk of propagating contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inclusion of multiple international contexts, including developed and lmic contexts, increases the risk of global disease spread.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of explicit inclusion of equity considerations in the literature review may perpetuate health disparities and lead to unequal access to healthcare resources.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global spread of infectious diseases through travel","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effective health and safety management in residential apartment buildings","category":"Living","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airports identified as efficient but expensive for controlling infection spread","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effectiveness of npis dependent on urban planning and design","category":"Urban Planning","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variable success of npis in different cities and countries","category":"Urban Planning","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Connectivity between districts impacting mortality during influenza pandemic","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of socioeconomic factors on pandemic spread","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spatial disparities in transport infrastructure correlated with h1n1 outbreak impacts","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global wastewater temperature modeling can help in predicting the impact of temperature on the degradation of biomarkers in wastewater, providing a basis for informed decision-making in public health responses.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underestimation of covid-19 prevalence due to seasonal temperature changes and wastewater temperatures","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of stable case load due to temperature changes not being accounted for","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changing population focus for wastewater-based epidemiology wbe observations due to seasonal temperature changes","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Desire to keep required sample sizes low for economic shipping.","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Need for a study on the decay and detectability of sars-cov-2 as a function of temperature.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disintegrated and non-interoperable data inhibits computer-assisted reasoning, hindering artificial intelligence.","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of bioinformatics tools hinders integration and analysis of heterogeneous data and knowledge.","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Propagation of contagious diseases through data sharing and integration","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of interoperability between ontologies","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Interoperability with over 300 other ontologies increases the risk of propagating inaccuracies and inconsistencies in disease data.","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases due to community-based metadata standardization for clinical and experimental studies.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fast and unstoppable disease transmission due to high human mobility","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited technology, knowledge, and resources make historical solutions to pandemics not applicable guidelines","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of sar-cov-2 in public spaces due to relaxation of restrictions","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Long-term Planning","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Refinement of practices in response to the pandemic, leaving fundamental approaches and values unchanged.","category":"Urban
